sentence: Why was the woman so attached to her dr. scholls gel insert? it was her sole comfort.
explanation: The word sole refers to the bottom part of a foot (first meaning) and can also mean being the only one (second meaning).
first_new_sentence: The sole of my shoe is worn out and needs replacing.
second_new_sentence: She was the sole survivor of the plane crash.

sentence: Did you hear about the guy who got chilled to absolute zero? hes 0k now.
explanation: The word ok indicates a state of being acceptable or satisfactory (first meaning) and is also a slang term for indicating agreement or acknowledgment (which can suggest everything is fine or fine-tuning a situation) (second meaning).
first_new_sentence: The project proposal was deemed ok by the committee.
second_new_sentence: After reviewing the changes, I said, Thatâ€™s ok with me.
